intro: Digitaria acuminatissima subsp. inermis, commonly known as slender fingergrass, is a grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various environmental conditions, contributing to its widespread distribution.
